definitions.definition: shut (a door, window, or lid) forcefully and loudly.
definitions.example: he slams the door behind him as he leaves

definitions.definition: a position in a sequence or series, typically one ordered on the basis of merit.
definitions.example: his score left him in ninth place

definitions.definition: put in a particular position.
definitions.example: a newspaper had been placed beside my plate

definitions.definition: find a home or employment for.
definitions.example: the children were placed with foster-parents

definitions.definition: identify or classify as being of a specified type or as holding a specified position in a sequence or hierarchy.
definitions.example: a survey placed the company 13th for achievement

definitions.definition: a square or short street.
definitions.example: the lecture theatre is in New Burlington Place

definitions.definition: a particular position, point, or area in space; a location.
definitions.example: I can't be in two places at once

definitions.definition: a portion of space designated or available for or being used by someone.
definitions.example: they hurried to their places at the table

definitions.definition: raise (one's shoulders) slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference.
definitions.example: Jimmy looked enquiringly at Pete, who shrugged his shoulders

definitions.definition: an act or instance of shrugging one's shoulders.
definitions.example: she lifted her shoulders in a dismissive shrug

definitions.definition: artificial insemination by donor.
help, typically of a practical nature.
definitions.example: he saw the pilot slumped in his cockpit and went to his aid

definitions.definition: help or support (someone or something) in the achievement of something.
definitions.example: women were aided in childbirth by midwives

definitions.definition: make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of derision.
definitions.example: he rarely smiled or laughed

definitions.definition: an act of laughing.
definitions.example: she gave a loud, silly laugh

definitions.definition: take and keep a firm hold of; grasp tightly.
definitions.example: his knuckles were white as he gripped the steering wheel

definitions.definition: (of an emotion or situation) have a strong or adverse effect on.
definitions.example: she was gripped by a feeling of excitement

definitions.definition: a firm hold; a tight grasp.
definitions.example: his arm was held in a vice-like grip

definitions.definition: effective control over something.
definitions.example: he had to take a grip on his nerves

definitions.definition: a travelling bag.
definitions.example: a grip crammed with new clothes

definitions.definition: a part or attachment by which something is held in the hand.
definitions.example: handlebar grips

definitions.definition: a stagehand in a theatre.
definitions.example: he was offered a job as a grip at the studio

definitions.definition: make an opening, incision, or wound in (something) with a sharp-edged tool or object.
definitions.example: he cut his big toe on a sharp stone

definitions.definition: remove (something) from something larger by using a sharp implement.
definitions.example: I cut his photograph out of the paper

definitions.definition: divide into pieces with a knife or other sharp implement.
definitions.example: cut the beef into thin slices

definitions.definition: make or form (something) by using a sharp tool to remove material.
definitions.example: workmen cut a hole in the pipe

definitions.definition: trim or reduce the length of (grass, hair, etc.) by using a sharp implement.
definitions.example: Ted was cutting the lawn

definitions.definition: reduce the amount or quantity of.
definitions.example: buyers will bargain hard to cut the cost of the house they want

definitions.definition: (of a line) cross or intersect (another line).
definitions.example: mark the point where the line cuts the vertical axis

definitions.definition: stop filming or recording.
definitions.example: √¢¬Ä¬òCut√¢¬Ä¬ô shouted a voice, followed by √¢¬Ä¬òCould we do it again, please?√¢¬Ä¬ô

definitions.definition: divide a pack of playing cards by lifting a portion from the top, either to reveal a card at random or to place the top portion under the bottom portion.
definitions.example: let's cut for dealer

definitions.definition: strike or kick (a ball) with an abrupt, typically downward motion.
definitions.example: Cook cut the ball back to him

definitions.definition: mix (an illegal drug) with another substance.
definitions.example: speed cut with rat poison

definitions.definition: an act of cutting, in particular:
definitions.example: his hair was in need of a cut

definitions.definition: a result of cutting something, in particular:
definitions.example: blood ran from a cut on his jaw

definitions.definition: the way or style in which something, especially a garment or someone's hair, is cut.
definitions.example: the elegant cut of his dinner jacket

definitions.definition: each of the possible gear ratios of a bicycle.
the light-gathering power or f-number of a camera lens.
the rate at which someone or something moves or operates or is able to move or operate.
definitions.example: we turned on to the runway and began to gather speed

definitions.definition: move quickly.
definitions.example: I got into the car and home we sped

definitions.definition: (in tenpin bowling) an act of knocking down all the pins with two balls.
additional to what is required for ordinary use.
definitions.example: few people had spare cash for inessentials

definitions.definition: with no excess fat; thin.
definitions.example: a spare, bearded figure

definitions.definition: elegantly simple.
definitions.example: her clothes are smart and spare in style

definitions.definition: an item kept in case another item of the same type is lost, broken, or worn out.
definitions.example: the wheel's broken and it would be suicide to go on without a spare

definitions.definition: give (something of which one has enough) to (someone).
definitions.example: she asked if I could spare her a bob or two

definitions.definition: refrain from killing, injuring, or distressing.
definitions.example: there was no way the men would spare her

definitions.definition: try to ensure or satisfy one's own comfort or needs.
definitions.example: in her concern to help others, she has never spared herself

definitions.definition: a gummy secretion found in the corners of the eyes after sleep.
definitions.example: she sat up, rubbing the sleep from her eyes

definitions.definition: a condition of body and mind which typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.
definitions.example: I was on the verge of sleep

definitions.definition: cover or enclose in paper or soft material.
definitions.example: he wrapped up the Christmas presents

definitions.definition: jump or dive quickly and energetically.
definitions.example: our little daughters whooped as they plunged into the sea

definitions.definition: push or thrust quickly.
definitions.example: he plunged his hands into his pockets

definitions.definition: an act of jumping or diving into water.
definitions.example: fanatics went straight from the hot room to take a cold plunge

definitions.definition: sound produced by continuous and regular vibrations, as opposed to noise.
vibrations that travel through the air or another medium and can be heard when they reach a person's or animal's ear.
definitions.example: light travels faster than sound

definitions.definition: music, speech, and sound effects when recorded and used to accompany a film, video, or broadcast.
definitions.example: a sound studio

definitions.definition: an idea or impression conveyed by words.
definitions.example: you've had a hard day, by the sound of it

definitions.definition: emit or cause to emit sound.
definitions.example: a loud buzzer sounded

definitions.definition: convey a specified impression when heard.
definitions.example: he sounded worried

definitions.definition: in good condition; not damaged, injured, or diseased.
definitions.example: they returned safe and sound

definitions.definition: a long surgical probe, typically with a curved, blunt end.
(of sleep) deep and undisturbed.
definitions.example: a doze that deepened into a sound sleep

definitions.definition: (of a beating) severe.
definitions.example: such people should be given a sound thrashing

definitions.definition: soundly.
definitions.example: he was sound asleep

definitions.definition: question (someone) discreetly or cautiously so as to ascertain their opinions on a subject.
definitions.example: we'll sound out parliament first

definitions.definition: (especially of a whale) dive down steeply to a great depth.
definitions.example: he sounded, arching his back steeply and raising his rubbery flukes in the air

definitions.definition: a narrow stretch of water forming an inlet or connecting two wider areas of water such as two seas or a sea and a lake.
definitions.example: he cast off and headed back across the sound

definitions.definition: based on valid reason or good judgement.
definitions.example: sound advice for healthy living

definitions.definition: ascertain (the depth of water in the sea, a lake, or a river), typically by means of a line or pole or using sound echoes.
definitions.example: Mr Pattison was sounding the depth of the water with a pole

definitions.definition: the chemical element of atomic number 49, a soft silvery-white metal occurring naturally in association with zinc and some other metals.
break suddenly and completely, typically with a sharp cracking sound.
definitions.example: guitar strings kept snapping

definitions.definition: (of an animal) make a sudden audible bite.
definitions.example: a dog was snapping at his heels

definitions.definition: say something quickly and irritably.
definitions.example: McIllvanney snapped at her

definitions.definition: take a snapshot of.
definitions.example: he planned to spend the time snapping rare wildlife

definitions.definition: remain alive.
definitions.example: the doctors said she had only six months to live

definitions.definition: make one's home in a particular place or with a particular person.
definitions.example: I've lived in the East End all my life

definitions.definition: not dead or inanimate; living.
definitions.example: live animals

definitions.definition: relating to a musical performance given in concert, not on a recording.
definitions.example: there is traditional live music played most nights

definitions.definition: (of a wire or device) connected to a source of electric current.
definitions.example: he touched a live rail while working on the track

definitions.definition: (of a question or subject) of current or continuing interest and importance.
definitions.example: the future organization of Europe has become a live issue

definitions.definition: as or at an actual event or performance.
definitions.example: the match will be televised live

definitions.definition: intend to convey or refer to (a particular thing); signify.
definitions.example: I don't know what you mean

definitions.definition: intend (something) to occur or be the case.
definitions.example: they mean no harm

definitions.definition: have as a consequence or result.
definitions.example: the proposals are likely to mean another hundred closures

definitions.definition: unkind, spiteful, or unfair.
definitions.example: I was mean to them over the festive season

definitions.definition: (especially of a place) poor in quality and appearance; shabby.
definitions.example: her home was mean and small

definitions.definition: a condition, quality, or course of action equally removed from two opposite extremes.
definitions.example: the measure expresses a mean between saving and splashing out

definitions.definition: (of a quantity) calculated as a mean; average.
definitions.example: participants in the study had a mean age of 35 years

definitions.definition: equally far from two extremes.
definitions.example: hope is the mean virtue between despair and presumption

definitions.definition: the value obtained by dividing the sum of several quantities by their number; an average.
definitions.example: acid output was calculated by taking the mean of all three samples

definitions.definition: propel (something) with force through the air by a movement of the arm and hand.
definitions.example: I threw a brick through the window

definitions.definition: send suddenly into a particular state or condition.
definitions.example: he threw all her emotions into turmoil

definitions.definition: send (one's opponent) to the ground in wrestling, judo, or similar activity.
definitions.example: in the final Arnaud was too strong, and threw Hughes twice

definitions.definition: form (ceramic ware) on a potter's wheel.
definitions.example: further on a potter was throwing pots

definitions.definition: have (a fit or tantrum).
definitions.example: occasionally a small child will throw a tantrum when denied something

definitions.definition: support; carry the weight of.
definitions.example: walls which cannot bear a stone vault

definitions.definition: a large, heavy mammal which walks on the soles of its feet, having thick fur and a very short tail. Bears are related to the dog family but have an omnivorous diet.
definitions.example: if I make a mistake he goes mad with rage√¢¬Ä¬îhe's a bear

definitions.definition: (of a person) carry.
definitions.example: he was bearing a tray of brimming glasses

definitions.definition: endure (an ordeal or difficulty).
definitions.example: she bore the pain stoically

definitions.definition: give birth to (a child).
definitions.example: she bore sixteen daughters

definitions.definition: turn and proceed in a specified direction.
definitions.example: bear left and follow the old drove road

definitions.definition: the push or surge created by a wave.
cause to go or be taken to a particular destination; arrange for the delivery of, especially by post.
definitions.example: we sent a reminder letter but received no reply

definitions.definition: cause to be in a specified state.
definitions.example: while driving in London I was sent crazy by roadworks

definitions.definition: (of a vessel) pitch or surge up in a heavy sea.
definitions.example: she scended forward, heavily and sickly, on the long swell
